Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: News18

Shilpa Shetty, a well-known figure in Bollywood, shares her approach to diet, emphasizing home-cooked meals and an enjoyable, balanced approach to eating.

  • She prefers simple, hearty meals and avoids restrictive diets.

title: Bombay Velvet’s Failure Still Haunts Amit Trivedi: 'It Shouldn’t Have Been This Bad' - News18
summary:
Bombay Velvet’s Failure Still Haunts Amit Trivedi: 'It Shouldn’t Have Been This Bad'

Publication Date: December 28, 2024
Source: News18

Despite grand expectations, the 2015 film Bombay Velvet directed by Anurag Kashyap turned out to be a colossal failure, impacting musician Amit Trivedi deeply as he reflects on his work on the movie.

  • The film, backed by Vikas Bahl and Vikramaditya Motwane, was based on the book Mumbai Fables by Gyan Prakash.
  • Amit Trivedi considered his time working on the film as one of the lowest phases of his career.
  • Trivedi devoted four years to the film’s music, expecting positive results but faced an unexpected disaster.
  • He aimed to introduce jazz music to Bollywood but was left feeling hopeless after the film's release.
  • He expressed disbelief over how negatively the film was received, stating, it shouldn't have been that bad.
“Shayad bahut mehnat chali gayi thi ussme... disaster expect nahi karoge” - Amit Trivedi
“Toh sab kuch disaster ho gaya, aaye gaye chala bhi nahi...” - Amit Trivedi

In conclusion, the failure of Bombay Velvet continues to haunt Amit Trivedi as he reflects on the significant amount of passion and effort he invested in the project, ultimately leading to feelings of despair.
newTitle: Bombay Velvet’s Failure Still Haunts Amit Trivedi: 'It Shouldn’t Have Been This Bad'

title: Pushpa 2 The Rule box office collection day 24: Allu Arjun film brings in over ₹1140 crore - Hindustan Times
Baby John box office collection day 4: Varun Dhawan film fails to gain momentum on Saturday, earns just Rs... - DNA India
summary:
Baby John Box Office Collection Day 4: Varun Dhawan Film Fails to Gain Momentum

Published on: December 28, 2024  |   Source: DNA India

Baby John, headlined by Varun Dhawan, is struggling at the box office, particularly in its fourth day of release. Despite the film's strong opening, it has failed to maintain momentum amidst stiff competition.

  • The film, released on December 25, garnered Rs 19.65 crore in its first three days in India.
  • On Saturday, it earned only Rs 3.57 crore, bringing its total to Rs 23.22 crore over four days.
  • Critics and audiences have delivered mixed to negative reviews for the film, citing predictability and a lack of originality.
  • Despite notable performances, the film is considered one of the biggest flops of the year.
“While a few have hailed Varun's performance, majority of the viewers have criticized the film for its predictability.”

Overall, Baby John is facing significant challenges at the box office, competing against the successful releases of Pushpa 2 and Mufasa.
newTitle: Baby John Box Office Collection: Varun Dhawan's Film Struggles to Gain Momentum

title: Rs 1000 Cr investment, Rs 700 Cr loss in 2024; Producers Association urges reduction in actors' pay - Mathrubhumi English
summary:
Producers Association Urges Reduction in Actors' Pay Amid Significant Losses in Malayalam Cinema

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mathrubhumi

The Producers Association of Malayalam cinema has reported major losses due to the failure of most films released in 2024, thus calling for a reduction in actors' remuneration.

  • In 2024, 199 films were released, totaling a production cost of approximately ₹1,000 crore.
  • Only 26 films were successful, recovering around ₹300 crore, while the losses amounted to ₹700 crore.
  • The association asserts that unless actors reduce their pay, the industry may face a potential crisis.
  • Five films grossed over ₹100 crore this year, including Manjummel Boys, which earned ₹242 crore.
  • Malayalam cinema contributed around 20% to India's total box-office gross for 2024.
“Given the high number of failures among recent releases, reducing costs has become unavoidable.”

The call for reduced pay comes as producers argue for survival within the industry, emphasizing the need for sustainable production practices.
newTitle: Producers Association Urges Reduction in Actors' Pay Amid Significant Losses in Malayalam Cinema

title: Marathi actor Urmila Kothare’s car runs over 2 workers in Kandivali; 1 killed - The Indian Express
summary:
Marathi actor Urmila Kothare’s car runs over 2 workers in Kandivali; 1 killed

Publication Date: Early Saturday morning

Source: Indian Express

In a tragic incident, Marathi actor Urmila Kothare’s vehicle struck two labourers working at a Metro construction site, resulting in one fatality and one injury.

  • The accident occurred around 12:45 AM near Poisar Metro station in Kandivali.
  • Kothare was reportedly heading home after dropping off a friend in Jogeshwari.
  • The driver has been booked for rash and negligent driving.
  • One labourer died at the scene, while the other was injured and is receiving treatment.
  • Both Kothare and her driver also sustained injuries.
“She had just wrapped up her shooting and was returning home when the incident took place,” a police officer said.

This incident raises concerns about road safety and the responsibilities of drivers.
newTitle: Tragic Accident Involving Marathi Actor Urmila Kothare in Kandivali

summary:
Urmila Kothare Accident: Marathi actress' car hits two metro workers in Mumbai, one dead

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: India TV News

Marathi actress Urmila Kothare was involved in a car accident in Mumbai that resulted in the death of one metro worker and injury to another. The incident occurred while she was returning from a shoot.

  • The accident took place in the Kandivali area of Mumbai last Friday.
  • Kothare was in the back seat of the car, with the driver at the wheel, who was confirmed not to be under the influence of alcohol.
  • The airbag deployed correctly, keeping both Kothare and the driver unharmed.
  • A case has been registered against the driver at Samta Nagar Police Station.
“The police team is investigating this entire matter.”

Kothare is a well-known figure in Marathi cinema, recognized for her roles in various films and TV shows.
